page.title: 19CONTEMPORARY LOCAL NEWS
page.content: A new road is to be built linking up the motorways with the A47 in the north east. It is to go over the existing Ring Road. Residents do not like the idea of a road carrying traffic passing through a residential area of the city. A new shopping complex has been built near the 'Woolco'. It is a 'Kwiksave' precinct. It is bound to provide competition for the present 'Woolco'. 'Woolco' have had difficulties recently with rain leaking through the ceiling, now stained with brown patches. The building was designed with car-parking facilities on its roof. Complaints continue about the speed of traffic down the London Road. It is not wide enough for two lanes but motorists form them by overtaking and often breaking the 30mph limit.
